demonstration_technique.description: Each chapter includes a scene where Lilith demonstrates mastery of the fetter Silas struggles with in the corresponding historical chapter
structure: Patient or colleague describes situation paralleling her pursuit of Silas
Physical tell undercuts her equanimity (shaking hands, tension, etc.)
She returns to tracking/intervention without applying her own advice
demonstration_technique.purpose: Creates devastating irony—she sees truth perfectly, articulates it beautifully, cannot apply it to herself

physical_cost.description: Tracking and intervention have bodily consequences that escalate
progression: CP-02 through CP-05: Increasing exhaustion, nausea
CP-06 through CP-09: Manifestation drains her for days; colleagues notice decline
CP-10: Full incarnation feels like dying and being born simultaneously

professional_decline.description: Her clinical career suffers as obsession grows
progression: CP-01 through CP-03: Thriving, building reputation
CP-04 through CP-06: Colleagues notice preoccupation
CP-07 through CP-08: Considering leave; patients affected
CP-10: Full leave; decade-long pursuit has consumed her life
CP-01: 15 years of self-tracking; opens new section 'Others'

maitreya_foreshadowing.description: Subtle hints planted throughout that they are connected at deeper level

Inexplicable pain when she causes him suffering

The attraction she keeps dismissing as tactical calculation
maitreya_foreshadowing.frequency: 1-2 subtle moments per chapter maximum; never explained

voice_notes.register: Contemporary literary; clinical vocabulary when appropriate
key_patterns: Undermining clause in every significant observation
Sensory anchoring (Manchester setting, her body, clinical spaces)
Loaded gestures (hand hovering over notebook, tension in shoulders)
Environmental metaphor (rain, institutional lighting, her increasingly cluttered flat)
forbidden: Buddhist terminology (meditation → practice, enlightenment → completion, etc.)
Abstract emotion words (render through physical sensation)
voice_notes.contrast_with_historical: These are the quietest chapters—calm professional exterior, stillness of practice, disturbing obsession beneath
